job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Requirements

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst translates complex business needs into structured requirements, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure clear, testable documentation and system alignment.

job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture and ensure secure design practices.
  • Monitor, detect, and respond to security threats, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • Secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Implement monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with security exposure.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools: Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions.
  • Strong expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP with secure architecture focus.
  • Proficiency in IaC (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Networking knowledge: LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers.
  • Familiarity with security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Monitoring tools: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM.
  • Scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Diploma/B.Tech/MCA in IT, CS, or MCA.
  • SOC operations experience or SIEM/SOAR tools exposure.
  • Certifications: AWS Security/DevOps Engineer – Professional, CKS, CEH, CompTIA Security+.

Benefits

  • Growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead secure infrastructure automation and DevSecOps practices. Architect cloud environments and CI/CD pipelines with IaC tools like Terraform and Ansible.

job_description:

  • Continuously improve models by incorporating new data and feedback.
  • Stay updated on advancements in AI and machine learning technologies.

  • Experience with LLMs (GPT-4, Llama-2) and NLP/RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation).

  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Contact: For inquiries, email your resume to careers@2basetechnologies.com.

job_description:
About Lean Transition Solutions (LTS)

Lean Transition Solutions (LTS) is a global Operational Excellence and Lean Industry 4.0 software company headquartered in the UK. For over a decade, we’ve helped large organizations turn strategy into action by combining Lean thinking, leadership principles, and modern, scalable technology. We are proud to be trusted by leading global organizations, supporting them in building sustainable, people-centric transformation at scale. With teams across India, Europe, the US, the Middle East, and Mexico, we operate as one connected global team. At LTS, we believe technology strengthens people, enabling them to do their best work. That belief shapes our products, our culture, and how we work together.

Role Overview

We are seeking a passionate and user-focused UI/UX Designer to create intuitive, engaging, and visually compelling digital experiences for web and mobile applications serving the manufacturing industry. The ideal candidate will excel at understanding user needs, designing user-centered solutions, and maintaining high design standards while collaborating closely with product managers, developers, and stakeholders. Proficiency in AI-powered design tools is a valuable asset that will enhance productivity and innovation.

Key Responsibilities

  1. User Experience (UX) Design
  2. Conduct user research to understand manufacturing workflows, user behavior, needs, and pain points
  3. Translate research insights into user personas, journey maps, and experience flows
  4. Design intuitive user flows and information architecture that enhance usability and engagement
  5. Create wireframes and user flows that optimize task completion and reduce complexity

  6. Apply UX best practices tailored to industrial and data-heavy applications

  7. User Interface (UI) Design

  8. Design clean, visually appealing interfaces for web and mobile applications
  9. Create cohesive UI elements including buttons, icons, typography systems, and color palettes
  10. Ensure visual consistency and brand alignment across all screens and digital platforms
  11. Design effective data visualization interfaces for dashboards, KPIs, and analytics

  12. Balance aesthetic excellence with functional requirements of manufacturing environments

  13. Figma Prototyping & Design Systems

  14. Build high-fidelity, interactive prototypes in Figma with animations and micro-interactions
  15. Create and maintain comprehensive component libraries and design systems
  16. Develop advanced prototypes that simulate real application behavior and workflows
  17. Establish reusable design patterns and maintain organized, scalable Figma files

  18. Utilize Figma's advanced features including auto-layout, variants, and constraints

  19. Front-End Development Integration

  20. Translate Figma designs into clean, semantic HTML5 and modern CSS3
  21. Write production-ready front-end code with proper structure and best practices
  22. Understand responsive design principles and implement mobile-first layouts
  23. Collaborate effectively with developers to ensure accurate design implementation

  24. Apply CSS frameworks and modern layout techniques (Flexbox, Grid, animations)

  25. Collaboration & Stakeholder Communication

  26. Work closely with product managers, developers, and stakeholders
  27. Present design concepts, user flows, and prototypes clearly

  28. Incorporate feedback while maintaining usability and design integrity

  29. Usability Testing & Validation

  30. Conduct usability testing and gather user feedback
  31. Identify usability issues and recommend design improvements

  32. Continuously optimize designs based on data and user insights

  33. Design Systems & Standards

  34. Follow and contribute to UI/UX design guidelines and design systems
  35. Maintain consistency in branding, interaction patterns, and accessibility

  36. Ensure adherence to usability and accessibility standards

  37. AI-Assisted Design

  38. Leverage AI design tools (Lovable, On Space, v0, etc.) to accelerate prototyping workflows
  39. Use LLMs (Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini) for design exploration, copywriting, and iteration
  40. Experiment with AI platforms to enhance productivity and design quality
  41. Apply AI-generated variations to explore alternative design directions

  42. Stay informed about emerging AI tools that can improve design processes

  43. Continuous Improvement & Trends

  44. Stay updated with the latest UI/UX trends, tools, and technologies
  45. Explore new design approaches to improve product experience
  46. Apply best practices in user-centered and human-centered design

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Proficiency in UI/UX design tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar
  • Strong understanding of UX principles, usability, and interaction design
  • Experience creating wireframes, prototypes, and user flows
  • Knowledge of responsive design and mobile-first design principles
  • Ability to translate business requirements into user-friendly designs
  • Strong visual design and problem-solving skills

Preferred Skills

  • Proficiency in design tools: Figma (primary), Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar
  • Experience creating wireframes, prototypes, and user flows
  • Knowledge of responsive design and mobile-first principles
  • Ability to translate business requirements into user-friendly designs
  • Understanding of design handoff and developer collaboration
  • Familiarity with AI-powered design/development platforms (Lovable, On Space, v0.dev, Bolt.new)
  • Basic experience using LLMs (Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini) for design-related tasks
  • Willingness to learn and adopt new AI tools as they emerge

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

  • Meaningful Work with Global Impact: Contribute to enterprise platforms used by world-class organizations such as Philips, Hitachi, Pfizer, and other global leaders—helping them improve how they operate, lead, and grow.
  • People-First, Collaborative Culture: Your ideas are heard, your work is valued, and you’re supported by a team built on trust and respect.
  • Purpose-Driven Technology: Build practical, thoughtful products that solve real operational and leadership challenges.
  • Growth & Ownership: Learn continuously, take ownership of your work, and grow your career in a supportive environment.
  • Global Exposure, Human Connection: Work with diverse teams and enterprise clients worldwide—while feeling connected and supported.
  • Quality, Security & Trust: Our platforms and processes are backed by internationally recognized ISO certifications, reflecting our strong commitment to quality, data security, and operational reliability.

Trois Infotech (P) Ltd

Address: 4th Floor, KSUM C DAC Building, Technopark, Trivandrum, 695581 Website: http://www.trois.in Contact Email: careers@trois.in

Job Title: Computer Vision/ML Engineer (Computer Vision)

Closing Date: 30, Jan 2026 Published: 23, Dec 2025

Brief Description

We are seeking a highly skilled Computer Vision/ML Engineer to design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning and deep learning solutions for real-world, production-grade systems. The ideal candidate will work on end-to-end Computer Vision pipelines spanning model development, optimization, deployment on edge/IoT platforms, and integration with enterprise applications. This role demands strong expertise in computer vision, deep learning frameworks, and production system design, along with the ability to collaborate effectively across multidisciplinary teams.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain reusable, testable, and efficient production-grade ML/DL code for computer vision pipelines.
  • Build and optimize low-latency, high-availability, and high-performance Computer Vision applications, including real-time and near-real-time systems.
  • Design, train, fine-tune, and evaluate computer vision models for detection, recognition, classification, and analytics use cases.
  • Assess, prioritize, and implement feature requests based on business, product, and technical requirements.
  • Collaborate with product, front-end, backend, firmware, and DevOps teams to understand user requirements and deliver robust technical solutions.
  • Integrate Computer Vision models with server-side logic, APIs, and user-facing components.
  • Design and integrate data storage solutions, including relational databases, NoSQL/key-value stores, object/blob storage, and feature stores.
  • Deploy and optimize models on GPU and edge Computer Vision/IoT platforms, ensuring performance, reliability, and scalability.
  • Consume HTTP REST and streaming APIs for inference and system integration.
  • Ensure adherence to software engineering best practices including version control, testing, documentation, CI/CD pipelines, and OWASP/CERT/MISRA guidelines for secure software development.

Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills - Strong programming expertise in Python and/or C++, with hands-on experience in PyTorch 2.x, Jax or both. - Demonstrable experience in Image Processing and Computer Vision, with a solid understanding of modern CNN/Transformer-based deep learning architectures, Object Detectors and Segmentation models, Object Tracking and related paradigms. - Ability to train and optimize computer vision models on single and multi-GPU systems. - Experience with GPU acceleration technologies; knowledge of CUDA and OpenCL is a strong plus. - Experience in mobile Computer Vision deployment is an advantage, including Java / Kotlin, TensorFlow Lite, CoreML. - Proficiency with the Linux command line (bash/zsh/fish shells mandatory), as most development and deployment involve remotely connected edge Computer Vision / IoT devices or cloud instances. - Working knowledge of HTTP REST and Websocket streaming APIs, RTSP and other real-time video and audio data streaming protocols. - Solid understanding of scalable system design principles, including performance optimization and fault tolerance. - Familiarity with event-driven architectures and asynchronous processing in the context of Python/Rust/C++ (e.g., Python asyncio, Rust async/tokio, Boost Async/libuv/C++ std::async (>= 17). - Understanding of platform-specific constraints and optimizations across mobile, desktop, edge, and server environments.

Educational Qualifications & Experience

  • B.Tech / B.E. + 4 or more years of relevant industry experience; M.Tech / M.E. with 2.5 years of relevant industry experience. Experience other than CV/ML/AI will not be considered.

Preferred Attributes

  • Experience with edge Computer Vision, embedded systems, or IoT-based deployments
  • Exposure to real-world production systems beyond research or prototyping
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a structured approach to debugging and optimization
  • Ability to work independently as well as in cross-functional teams
  • Passion for building impactful Computer Vision solutions at scale
summary: Designs and deploys ML/DL solutions for production-grade computer vision systems. Requires expertise in deep learning frameworks and scalable system design.
